intro: Weddellina squamulosa f. uaupensis, commonly known as the Uaupés weddellia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Brazilian Atlantic Forest. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family, characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that collect water and nutrients. The plant's leaves are covered in dense, scale-like structures that help reduce water loss in its humid, shaded habitat. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are often hidden within the leaf rosette. Due to habitat destruction, this species is considered critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
